The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests or on rocky slopes. Its reproductive structures, including sori and indusia, are small and closely clustered, typical of its fern group. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited conservation efforts in place.
